data.title: Tradition
data.text: We lived in Pueblo in the 1960s and 70s. On return trips to this area, we make it a point to stop at Passkey, either on Abriendo or Hwy 50. Haven't tried the ones in Pueblo West or on Northern. We always order the "special" and have never been disappointed.

data.title: Old Pueblo
data.text: I love the sandwiches. To be a real Puebloan you must eat here at least once in your life. I am not sure about the "Worlds Best" but is very very good

data.title: The best
data.text: We always stop at the one on abriendo because it always tastes like passkey  should the best Italian sausage sandwich on the planet it was crowded it was busy it was outstanding there isn't a better one in the world

data.title: Impromtu
data.text: Wasn't expecting anything per se but pleasantly surprised by the special Italian sausage sandwich. Likewise my wife was surprised at the good quality and taste of the grilled chicken salad.

data.title: PASS KEY SPECIAL
data.text:
Honestly, I haven't tried anything else on the menu as I don't want to, I only go there for The Pass Key Special w/provolone.
On busy days the services does suffer somewhat :(
Also, on a few visits they gave us green cherry peppers. When asked for the normal sweet peppers that are served, they said that they were out for the season but if we wanted to purchase a jar of them from up front where they're sold, we can! Why not pop those babies open and serve them along w/the meal?

data.title: Pueblo in a Greasy Nutshell
data.text: Yes, yes, this place has an inexplicably revered signature sausage sandwich, often the consistency of cardboard, and they've been serving it the same way for seven hundred years. And there are many people who love it. And those people deserve this place, which also serves the worst cheeseburger known to mankind and has no vegetarian meals on its menu. Oh, and it's closed on Sundays, which cements its place as a perfect Pueblo gastronomic hazard: it'll give you a stomach ache half the time and it's closed on Sundays. And the one on Northern is even worse. But bon apetit to youse, Pueblo.

data.title: Consistently awesome!
data.text: Probably the best food in pueblo! We make the trek down from the springs just to have lunch. The staff is on the ball too,even though they are always busy.

data.title: If you love Italian sausage, you need to try this place.  I live In KC MO and get hungry for a passkey sandwich all the
data.text: Excellent place to eat, great service, diner atmosphere, they have really good homemade french fries also.  Very reasonably priced

data.title: Great Find for  strangers passing thru town.
data.text:
We were looking for a late breakfast and searched for a spot in Pueblo on a Saturday . I I took a quick exit on a road with a 4 star rated place nearby .This was the original drive up carhop location of. 4 store enterprise . No breakfast but any type sandwich was available . My wife had a BLT on Texas toast stuffed and tasty. The biggest treat was the pass key special Italian sausage on a hoagie roll .... fabulous green chile and tasty fries.
I felt like diners drive-ins and dives has nothing on me . I definitely plan on a rematch with that Super Pass key special on my return in September

data.title: Always the best
data.text: This is the original passkey and the food always tastes better here than any of the other restaurants I don't know why but let me tell you this is the best sausage sandwich anywhere in America don't pass this one up a gem

data.title: As great as I remember!
data.text:
I used to come to this restaurant when I was a child with my parents and grandparents. I remember never had I tasted anything like an Italian sausage sandwich before. We are of Mexican heritage and this was not chorizo AND there was this cheese I never tasted anywhere else either. Now that I am older, and whenever I can get to it, I stop at the original Pass Key on Abriendo. We were here Saturday, and I'm so happy we had time to stop. 

The restaurant had that wonderful diner spice smell. The food was the same great quality and taste that it has always been. The staff were so friendly and informative. I had my two daughters and two grandsons with me and I can say I have have been to this restaurant with five generations of my family. I hope it lasts for many more years. I hope my grandkids can bring there kids here for a sandwich sometime. I hope to be back soon.
